skillTree.localised_description: A motorised ball of whirling, razor-sharp, eviscerating death, designed to plough through enemy lines with hellish vigour.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Those opponents who smile at first sight of this powerful war machine clearly have no idea what's about to hit them!

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Furtive, scheming, sly, cunning, underhand, devious, conniving, double-dealing, and sneaky - valuable traits if you wish to stay alive!
All Skaven are unprincipled and untrustworthy by their foul natures. However, this is rarely a disadvantage in the face of the enemy.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Warp-energy is pulsing - through his veins a charge is racing. On a scale of one to ten, this one's operating on eleven!
Treachery is always a risk; advancing others' careers can quickly become a fatal mistake. However, having accomplished students in your team can outweigh the dangers.
This new and improved device upgrades Ikit's earlier invention for maximum efficiency.

effects.description: +50% chance to acquire Warp-fuel after battle

skillTree.localised_description: You can tweak and prime weapons to your heart's content, but there remains no substitute for a live ammunition test against an equally-murderous foe!
Finding assembly lines inefficient and therefore unsatisfactory, Ikit organises his Skaven workforce to manufacture his designs faster and better than the competition.

effects.description:
Local Recruitment duration: -1 turn for Doomflayer and Doomwheel units
	(Lord's army)

Recruit rank: +1 for Doomflayer and Doomwheel units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: When the end finally comes, this one will be there, cackling like the supremely mad scientist he is.

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs units with 25 or more entities

skillTree.localised_description: This advanced armour is infused with purest Warp-energy, making it more powerful than other protective measures employed by the Skaven.
Shake his hand? You'd better count your limbs, my friend!
Ikit is famed for his ability to mix magic with mechanical technology; this multi-layered Warp-infused armour affords far more protection than merely extra padding, therefore.
Enormous fun, and guaranteed to surprise the foe, but a proper nightmare when it cuts out mid-air!
Ikit is alerted to potential health issues by his multifarious inventions, by which ailments can easily be cured, ensuring he is always in peak condition.
"Power surge now, exploding through, yes-yes-yes-YES!!!!!!"

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.

skillTree.localised_description: Be wary of one who can renergise himself in the middle of the battle, lest the tide be turned!
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Warp Lightning"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Warp Lightning Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Warp Lightning Upgraded"

Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Howling Warpgale Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Howling Warpgale Upgraded"

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: Unlimited power corrupts the already-totally-corrupted utterly.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: To rise above the rank and file, to claw one's way above the mire and the filth, takes a certain, superior breed of Skaven.

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Clanrats units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Having to hide, for an extended period, in a dark, dank recess, in order to entrap and kill your target encourages lateral thinking.

skillTree.localised_description: Knowing exactly where and when to strike is essential when fielding fiendish, potentially battle-winning plague-weapons.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Is it better to be respected or feared? What sort of question is that... why, both of course!

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +3% for Stormvermin, Death Runners, Plague Monks and Eshin Triads units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one has seen the hideous deformities created by Clan Moulder firsthand and now fancies himself a dab hand with a needle and thread…

skillTree.localised_description: This one's intimate knowledge of the inner workings of Skaven machinery enables him to improve their efficiency on the battlefield.

skillTree.localised_description: The wise commander considers the lash a dear friend - so much more than a motivational tool to encourage correctness in spirit and behaviour.

	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Skavenslaves, Clanrats and Stormvermin units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Early years spent in the gutter both prepares the ambitious rat for power and schools him in the dirtier, more cut-throat ways of war.

Leadership: +5 for Gutter Runners, Night Runners, Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +20% for Death Runners and Eshin Triads units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Range: +15% for Gutter Runners and Night Runners units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This one knows just what to say to 'encourage' the very best work from his underling Warp-smiths and technicians.

Leadership: +5 for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayers, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 15% for Weapon Team, Doom-Flayer, Doomwheel, Plagueclaw Catapult and Warp Lightning Cannon units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Potions infused with Warpstone transmogrify the not-always-willing testbed subjects; those who survive the process emerge stronger and better in every way.

effects.description:
Armour: +10 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical resistance: 10% for Wolf Rats, Rat Ogres, Mutant Rat Ogre, Brood Horror, Hell Pit Abomination and Plague Monks units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Those that excel as looters make sure that every coin or gold tooth is found and added to the plunder. Woe betide the warrior that misses even a single copper token!

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +4%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +8%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +12%

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
Keeping on top of things with an iron fist prevents Skavendom from becoming too much of a degenerate mess.
Naturally, rats get in everywhere – even the tiniest opening presents little obstacle – spreading their disease and corruption everywhere they can.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
When making corpses of your foes, leave nothing of value for their kin to recover.

effects.description: Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +5%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +10%
Post battle chance of stealing a magic item: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

factionEffects.localised_description: Few will ever come close to Clan Skryre’s pre-eminent inventor, whose name is carved into history through his deadly machines of destruction.

effects.description: Gain access to the Clan Skryre Forbidden Workshop

items.colour_text: A Warpstone-powered device, created by the Warlock Engineers, that crackles with barely-contained power.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

item_set.name: Destructive Engineering
item_set.description: Every creation fashioned by the Chief Warlock-Engineer is a marvel of science and sorcery.

items.colour_text: A mighty metal frame encases the Warlock Engineer's body, giving him amazing strength, dexterity and resistance against both physical and magical harm.

item_set.name: Destructive Engineering
item_set.description: Every creation fashioned by the Chief Warlock-Engineer is a marvel of science and sorcery.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Rising to this position was inevitable, for no other Warlock Engineer is as influential as the infamous, devastating Ikit Claw.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -35% for Warplock Jezzails, Ratling Gun and Warpfire Thrower Weapons Team units
	(Lord's army)
Recruit rank: +1 for Warpfire Thrower, Ratling Gun, Poisoned Wind Globadiers, Poisoned Wind Mortars and Death Globe Bombardiers units
